Good ad-free alerts app. Lets you specify the exact kinds of alerts you want for your area and others. It's only drawback is that its county-wide. Some alerts are issued for only specific areas of counties. This app would be perfect if would allow you to set alerts to a precise location (not just county-wide) as some other apps do. Also it needs other notification options (such as a voice or different sound) for alerts so they don't get lost with other notifications.

I am deleting this app. I get 6 or more notifications a day when we are getting 2-4 inches of snow. It wakes me in the middle of the night to update when I have already recieved the same notification before. It's too bad, I liked getting the bitter windchill warning. If the weather was serious it would be fine but I don't consider 4 inches of snow a blizzard.
Awesome

I thoroughly enjoy this app! Up to date on active warnings - unlike other local weather apps!

Into a busy season and it's worse (after weather alert this morning there have been at least 5 false/blank alerts). Even after clearing cache, rebooting phone, etc still getting multiples of same exact alerts and several alerts with little or no lead time and now (once again) many - almost 40% - warnings with no info at all or nothing updated in the alert information. That's probably FEMA but still seriously downgrades usefulness. So problematic that other weather apps are needed for safety.

So I love this app, but I feel as if you guys should check the reviews. There are people there with legitimate concerns, and some great recommendations that your should take look at. Such as: -Missing Alerts -A "Follow Me" option. -A priority alert mode (that fully covers your screen when you get a warning alert). I had a tornado warning in my area, and I love that I recieved it when using the app, but you should force the users to see a warning. These are the 3 options I'd love to see come.

App has grown over the years and I appreciate the work that has gone into making it. My alerts are timely for the different counties that I've entered. THAT being said: The app has the potential to be so much more. Save lives. Can you please make it less time consuming to use? When I travel I need to hear *alerts in the County I'm IN.* What I would like to see in an update is the use of GPS to alert me *wherever* I am. Also.. Why isn't anyone taking advantage of the Blog section?
replyContent:
Hi Dawn,

Thank you for your feedback. We are currently investigating the issue of inconsistent alert delivery and are conducting internal testing. We hope to resolve this issue in the upcoming release. We are committed to addressing issues and improving the FEMA App so it is a useful tool for our users.

Installed this app months ago and expected this would be the moment for it. I'm getting "red flag warnings" and "evacuation alerts" every few minutes (with no date or timestamp) that just say things like "GO NOW Eden Road" with a web link I can't click or copy. After switching back and forth between apps to type out it turns out it's a map and Eden Road is 60 miles away. You can't set alerts for regions smaller than the entire county. Evac notices also came through sooner with other services.

A good app from the government? Shocker. In all seriousness it's actually very useful. I like being able to keep updated on the town my family lives in as well as where I am now. I used to use the "Emergency" app from the Red Cross for this purpose. However this app is better because it shows less severe alerts. For example I live in a low lying area so it's good to get flood notifications, even if it's just a watch. Same with high surf warnings. The Red Cross app only shows high level alerts.

replyContent: We rely on user feedback to improve the FEMA App and to ensure that it is useful for real people. Please let us know if you have suggestions for how to make the FEMA App better by emailing FEMA-New-Media@fema.dhs.gov.

content: Great

Looking forward to this App for info in the next few days as we hunker down and try to stay safe SINCE Hurricane Dorian is due to hit our NC coast (Sunset Beach) only 6 miles away from our house. This is getting to be too common an occurrence  since we've battled the last three years through devastating hurricanes. Let you know if we keep the 5 Stars after our experience with Dorian.

content: got the answers i needed after the Camp Fire.

No alerts, even though Weather Underground published this this morning. Not a peep out of my Android cell FEMA app. even though I subscribed to this alert.   The National Weather Service in Upton has issued a Small Craft Advisory, which is in effect from 6 AM to 6 PM EDT Friday.  * WINDS...Northwest winds 10 to 20 kt with gusts up to 25 kt.  PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...  A Small Craft Advisory means that sustained wind speeds or frequent gusts of 25 to 33 kt and/or seas of 5 ft or higher are expected or occurring, and hazardous to small craft. Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller vessels, should avoid navigating in these conditions.  Registered app for 06405 Branford.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. The FEMA App amplifies alerts from local  authorities, such as the National Weather Service. To check if your location is set up to receive Small Craft Advisory alerts, first tap on your location in the Alerts section, and then scroll down to "Marine Weather" where you can opt in to Small Craft Advisory alerts.

Our design & development team is also researching how we might introduce sound customization and alert audio files into the app in the future. We are committed to improving the product so it works best for our users.

replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. The FEMA App provides a direct link to DisasterAssistance.gov, but does not offer a secure way to log into your account with Disaster Assistance. We hope that we might be able to offer a better experience in the future that is both simple and secure.

It's been a good app for keeping up on the weather warnings. I would have giving 5 stars, but lately I have been getting alerts for an area that I have not selected.
replyContent: Hi, the FEMA App amplifies alerts sent by local alerting authorities. In most cases, the alert will have a section at the top that is labeled as the "Areas Affected." If one of these areas lies in the same county as you, but is not your city or zip code location, you may still receive the alert because they are pulled by county.

You may need to uninstall and reinstall the app, and then re-enter the locations for which you want to receive alerts. I hope this information is useful and improves your experience.

content: We have had some hot weather and a lot of rain.  I have 3 locations set for Minnesota and I bet I get 25 - 35 alerts a day for flood  watches, flood warnings, heat advisories, heat warnings etc.  I don't want flood and heat alerts..but there is no way to turns those types of alerts off, so I uninstalled.
replyContent: Hi, thank you for your feedback. We will release a new version of the FEMA App that will allow you to customize which alerts you want to receive for each location you enter. In the future we hope to address the issue of duplicate alerts for different areas in the same county. We apologize for the inconvenience & are committed to improving the app.

content: The alerts isn't working on my Google pixel XL
Broken. I can no longer see the alerts, though I do get notifications.
replyContent: Hi Tim, thank you for your feedback. We recently released an update, so please make sure you are running version 2.9.4. You may need to uninstall and re-install the app. If you continue to experience problems, we will be releasing another update soon. We apologize for the inconvenience and are committed to providing an app that is reliable.

content: I upgraded to version 2.9.4 and now i get no notifications.  I can go into the app and see alerts but they don't notify me when they come in.
Op. Don't press the 911 button

Great app.  However, after upgrading my phone OS to Oreo, I lost the notifications and any ability to set them.  I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app several times.  Without notifications, the app isn't nearly as helpful.

It's a pretty good and simple disaster app, but they should implement a 
dark mode. Most phones use OLED displays, and OLED displays don't use 
battery when showing the color black. A dark mode would be very useful and 
would help save battery (which you would want to do in an emergency 
situation).
Great app .

Would like to see option for user selectable alert sounds in the app for 
each alert. Can't depend on having that option in the OS as that capability 
varies by brand and model.

Generally happy, especially for the urgent issues. Lately, even with 2.9.4, 
I often (as others report) receive an alert but when the app opens it lists 
no current alert. Also, I have occasionally been woken by the app's alert 
only to find that the region might have a bit of fog in the morning - not 
something I want to lose sleep over.
I love it

I've uninstalled this app because weather warnings show up as peeks, but 
when I click on them there is no info and it says there is no alert. Plus 
fog warnings are annoying
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We recently released an update that should correct this issue. Please make sure you update the FEMA App so you are running 2.9.4, since the bug was in 2.9.3. We apologize for the inconvenience.

content: App will send notifications but when I click on them, nothing pops up.
replyContent: Hi Ray, thank you for your feedback. We released version 2.9.4 to correct this bug, so please make sure your device is running the most recent version of the app. We appreciate your input and hope to improve your experience with our app.

content: Alerts all the time but then the app says no current alerts.
replyContent: Hi Danielle, thank you for your feedback. We recently released an update to the app, so please make sure you are running 2.9.4 on your device. We are committed to resolving issues and improving your experience.

content:
I receive alerts but when I tap on the notification and then the app comes

upon receiving the alert. It's annoying that I have to wait for few minutes 
just to view the full alert.
replyContent: Thank you for letting us know about your experience. We have released an update (version 2.9.4) that should correct the issue. We are continuing to make improvements that will ensure that the alerts are reliable, fast, and informative. We appreciate your patience and apologize for the inconvenience.

Really helpful. Mainly gives weather alerts but really helpful.
